fif_core

Class SequenceFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • fif_core.Filter
      • fif_core.SequenceFilter

  • public class SequenceFilter
extends Filter
    This class represent a sequence filter, that is a composite structure for two or more filters in which the order is important and the output of a filter filtering is the input of the next filter.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Troiano Lorenzo

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SequenceFilter(Filter... list)
      Builder that sets the the list of filters composing the parallel filter.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SequenceFilter

        public SequenceFilter(Filter... list)
        Builder that sets the the list of filters composing the parallel filter.

        You can set a variable numbers of filters.

        The order is extremely important. The same order you set the parameters, the same it will be set into the sequence.
        So, first parameter is first element of the sequence, second parameter second element etc...

        Preconditions:

        1-None of the filters must be null.

        Postconditions:

        1-The filters are set correctly.

        Parameters:
        list - The list of filters you want to set in this filter.

    • Method Detail

      • doFilter

        public double doFilter(Resource r,
                       double value)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Overridden method of Filter class: provides the filtering for the sequence filter structure.

        The output value is calculated filtering with each filter, according to sequence: each filter take an input from the previous filter and give the output to the next filter. The output of the last filter is the final filtered value returned from this method.

        Preconditions:

        1-The resource is not equal to null.
        2-The value is not equal to null.

        Postconditions:

        1-The filtering is done correctly returning a value between 0 and 1.

        Specified by:
        doFilter in class Filter
        Parameters:
        r - The resource you want to filter.
        value - The maximum threshold value of the filtering.
        Returns:
        the aggregated filtered value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getAllFilters

        public java.util.AbstractList<Filter> getAllFilters()
        This method returns an abstract list of all the filters in the sequence filter.

        You can modify internal state of the sequence filter using the abstract list methods.

        Postconditions:

        1-It's returned the list of filters.

        Returns:
        the list of filters

      • setSequence

        public void setSequence(Filter... list)
        This method allows to set a list of filters composing the sequence filter.

        Every time you call this method, the previous internal filters are destroyed and replaced by the new filters.
        You can set a variable numbers of filters.
        The order is extremely important. The same order you set the parameters, the same it will be set into the sequence.
        So, first parameter is first element of the sequence, second parameter second element etc...

        Preconditions:

        1-None of the filters must be null.

        Postconditions:

        1-The filters are set correctly.

        Parameters:
        list - The list of filters you want to set in this filter.
